title: As I Open My Eyes
creator_credit: Ciclic - Région Centre, Ministère des Affaires Étrangères, Centre du Cinéma et de l'Audiovisuel de la Fédération Wallonie-Bruxelles, VOO, Visions Sud Est, Hélicotronc, Blue Monday Productions, L'Aide aux Cinémas du Monde, Propaganda Production, Ministère Tunisien de la Culture, Moulin d'Andé-CECI, Emergence, Arab Fund for Arts and Culture, CNC, Anthony Rey, Imed Marzouk, Leyla Bouzid, Sandra da Fonseca, Marie-Sophie Chambon, Raouf Hiloui and Nadia Anane
headline_credit: Belgium, France, Tunisia and United Arab Emirates, 2015
brief_description: As I Open My Eyes (French: À peine j’ouvre les yeux) is a 2015 French-Tunisian drama film directed by Leyla Bouzid.
creator_credit_for_label: Ciclic - Région Centre, Ministère des Affaires Étrangères, Centre du Cinéma et de l’Audiovisuel de la Fédération Wallonie-Bruxelles, VOO, Visions Sud Est, Hélicotronc, Blue Monday Productions, L’Aide aux Cinémas du Monde, Propaganda Production, Ministère Tunisien de la Culture, Moulin d’Andé-CECI, Emergence, Arab Fund for Arts and Culture, CNC, Anthony Rey, Imed Marzouk, Leyla Bouzid, Sandra da Fonseca, Marie-Sophie Chambon, Raouf Hiloui and Nadia Anane
headline_credit_for_label: Belgium, France, Tunisia and United Arab Emirates, 2015
description: Tunis, summer 2010, a few months before the Revolution: Farah, 18 years old, has just graduated and her family already sees her as a future doctor. But she doesn’t have the same idea. She sings in a political rock band, has a passion for life, gets drunk, discovers love and her city by night against the wishes of her mother Hayet, who knows Tunisia and its dangers all too well.
description_for_label: Tunis, summer 2010, a few months before the Revolution: Farah, 18 years old, has just graduated and her family already sees her as a future doctor. But she doesn’t have the same idea.
